channel.title: CVE Feed for ValvePress -- WordPress Automatic Plugin
channel.description: The latest CVEs for ValvePress -- WordPress Automatic Plugin

item.title: CVE-2021-4374|2024-08-03T17:23:10.710Z -- valvepress -- wordpress%20automatic%20plugin
item.description: The WordPress Automatic Plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to arbitrary options updates in versions up to, and including, 3.53.2. This is due to missing authorization and option validation in the process_form.php file. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to arbitrarily update the settings of a vulnerable site and ultimately compromise the entire site.

item.title: CVE-2024-4849|2024-08-01T20:55:10.281Z -- valvepress -- wordpress%20automatic%20plugin
item.description: The WordPress Automatic Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘autoplay’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.94.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-4849|2024-06-04T17:53:32.373Z -- valvepress -- wordpress%20automatic%20plugin
item.description: The WordPress Automatic Plugin plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘autoplay’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.94.0 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.
